selected_quotes: Sadly @rcpsych is also biased on mental health. Depression due to mild inflammation doesn't fit their belief system.
Out of date? Demand a physical test! Inflammation depression Just like psychosis
@DrQuekett Recent SSRI - consider manic adverse reaction? Depression - consider inflammation?
@MarkOneinFour If you have the money consider this Is Depression an Inflammatory Disorder?

citation.abstract: Studies consistently report that groups of individuals with major depressive disorder (MDD) demonstrate increased levels of a variety of peripheral inflammatory biomarkers when compared with groups of nondepressed individuals. These findings are often interpreted as meaning that MDD, even in medically healthy individuals, may be an inflammatory condition. In this article, we examine evidence for and against this idea by looking more closely into what the actual patterns of inflammatory findings indicate in terms of the relationship between MDD and the immune system. Data are presented in support of the idea that inflammation only contributes to depression in a subset of patients versus the possibility that the depressogenic effect of inflammatory activation is more widespread and varies depending on the degree of vulnerability any given individual evinces in interconnected physiologic systems known to be implicated in the etiology of MDD. Finally, the treatment implications of these various possibilities are discussed.
citation.title: Is Depression an Inflammatory Disorder?

news.title: Could tamping down inflammation lift the fog of depression?
news.summary: One of the world’s largest drug makers is testing a radical new approach to treating depression — by dialing down inflammation in the body, rather than tinkering with chemicals in the brain.

news.title: The Strategies That Science Actually Shows Are Effective For Depression
news.summary: Depression is now the leading cause of disability across the globe. That’s a huge statistic in itself—it means that more people are disabled because of depression than by any other physical or mental health issue out there.

news.title: Suicidal thoughts linked to brain inflammation in people with depression
news.summary: Patients with major depressive disorder had more signs of inflammation in the brain than healthy people, scientists at the University of Manchester have found.
